value: Our God and Savior now draws near: O come let us worship.
[Alleluia.] Our God is glorious in all the saints: O come let us worship.  [Alleluia.]

value.text: God is Spirit, and those who worship must worship in spirit and in truth.
Jesus said: “If any of you would come after me, deny yourself and take up your cross and follow me.”
Arise, O Jerusalem, stand upon the height and look toward the east, and see your children gathered from west and east at the word of the Holy One.

value: Our God and Savior now draws near: O come let us worship.

value.text: The Word became flesh and dwelt among us, full of grace and truth.
May the God of hope fill us with all joy and peace in believing through the power of the Holy Spirit.
You are no longer strangers and sojourners, but citizens together with the saints and members of the household of God.
God is Spirit, and those who worship must worship in spirit and in truth.
Christ Jesus, being found in human form, humbled himself and became obedient unto death, even death on a cross.
Shower, O heavens, from above, and let the skies rain down righteousness; let the earth open, that salvation may spring up, and let it cause righteousness to sprout up also.
If anyone is in Christ, there is a new creation: everything old has passed away; see,  everything has become new!

value: Our God is full of compassion and mercy: O come let us worship.

value.text: Jesus said: “If any of you would come after me, deny yourself and take up your cross and follow me.”

value: God is the Rock of our salvation: O come let us worship.

value.text: Shower, O heavens, from above, and let the skies rain down righteousness; let the earth open, that salvation may spring up,and let it cause righteousness to sprout up also.
If anyone is in Christ, there is a new creation: everything old has passed away; see,  everything has become new!
Arise, O Jerusalem, stand upon the height and look toward the east, and see your children gathered from west and east at the word of the Holy One.

value: The holy and undivided Trinity, one God: O come let us worship.
Christ has shown forth his glory: O come let us worship.

value.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, and the love of God, and the fellowship of the Holy Spirit, be with us all evermore.
Glory to God whose power, working in us, can do infinitely more than we can ask or imagine: Glory to God from generation to generation in the Church, and in Christ Jesus for ever and ever.

value: Our God and Savior now draws near: O come let us worship.
The holy and undivided Trinity, one God: O come let us worship.

value.text: Christ Jesus, being found in human form, humbled himself and became obedient unto death, even death on a cross.
The Word became flesh and dwelt among us, full of grace and truth.
You are no longer strangers and sojourners, but citizens together with the saints and members of the household of God.
Shower, O heavens, from above, and let the skies rain down righteousness; let the earth open, that salvation may spring up, and let it cause righteousness to sprout up also.

value: Alleluia. Christ is risen. O come let us worship. Alleluia.

value.verse: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, *
value.halfverse: by divine mercy we have a new birth into a living hope;
we have an inheritance that is imperishable in heaven.
value.verse: Through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead, *

value.halfverse: was not paid in silver or gold,
value.verse: The ransom that was paid to free us *
But in the precious blood of Christ, *
value.halfverse: the Lamb without spot or stain.

value.verse: God raised Jesus from the dead and gave him glory *
value.halfverse: so that we might have faith and hope in God.

value.verse:
My soul proclaims the greatness of the Lord,
my spirit rejoices in you, O God my Savior; *
value.halfverse: for you have looked with favor on your lowly servant.

value.verse: From this day all generations will call me blessed: *
value.halfverse:
you, the Almighty, have done great things for me,
and holy is your Name.
from generation to generation.
value.verse: You have mercy on those who fear you *

value.halfverse: and scattered the proud in their conceit,
value.verse: You have shown strength with your arm, *

value.halfverse: and lifting up the lowly.
value.verse: Casting down the mighty from their thrones,

value.halfverse: and sent the rich away empty.
value.verse: You have filled the hungry with good things, *

value.halfverse: for you have remembered your promise of mercy,
value.verse: You have come to the help of your servant Israel, *

value.halfverse: to Abraham and his children for ever.
value.verse: The promise you made to our forebears, *

Before I ventured forth,
even while I was very young, *
value.halfverse: I sought wisdom openly in my prayer.
and I will seek her to the end.
value.verse: In the forecourts of the temple I asked for her, *

value.halfverse: she has been the delight of my heart.
value.verse: From first blossom to early fruit, *

value.halfverse: diligently from my youth have I pursued her.
value.verse: My foot has kept firmly to the true path, *

value.halfverse: I found for myself much wisdom and became adept in her.
value.verse: I inclined my ear a little and received her; *

value.halfverse: for I have resolved to live according to her way.
value.verse: To the one who gives me wisdom will I give glory, *

value.halfverse: therefore I will not be forsaken.
value.verse: From the beginning I gained courage from her, *

value.halfverse: therefore have I gained a good possession.
value.verse: In my inmost being I have been stirred to seek her, *

value.halfverse: and with it will I offer praise to God.
value.verse: As my reward the Almighty has given me the gift of language, *

value.halfverse: you have come to your people and set them free.
value.verse: Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel; *

value.halfverse: born of the house of your servant David.
value.verse: You have raised up for us a mighty savior, *

Through your holy prophets you promised of old,
that you would save us from our enemies, *
value.halfverse: from the hands of all who hate us.
and to remember your holy covenant.
value.verse: To show mercy to our forebears *

value.halfverse: to set us free from the hands of our enemies,
value.verse: This was the oath you swore to our father Abraham, *
Free to worship you without fear, *
value.halfverse:
holy and righteous before you,
all the days of our life.
for you will go before the Lord to prepare the way,
value.verse: And you, child, shall be called the prophet of the Most High, *

value.halfverse: by the forgiveness of their sins.
value.verse: To give God’s people knowledge of salvation *

value.halfverse: the dawn from on high shall break upon us,
value.verse: In the tender compassion of our God *

value.halfverse: and to guide our feet into the way of peace.
value.verse:
To shine on those who dwell in darkness
and the shadow of death, *
I will take you from among all nations; *
value.halfverse: and gather you from all lands to bring you home.
and purify you from false gods and uncleanness.
value.verse: I will sprinkle clean water upon you; *

value.halfverse: and a new spirit put within you.
value.verse: A new heart I will give you *
I will take the stone heart from your chest *
value.halfverse: and give you a heart of flesh.

value.verse: I will help you walk in my laws *
value.halfverse: and cherish my commandments and do them.

value.verse: You shall be my people, *
value.halfverse: and I will be your God.
the desert shall rejoice and blossom;
value.verse: The wilderness and the dry land shall be glad, *
It shall blossom abundantly, *
value.halfverse: and rejoice with joy and singing.
the majesty of our God.
value.verse: They shall see the glory of the Lord, *

value.halfverse: and make firm the feeble knees.
value.verse: Strengthen the weary hands, *
Say to the anxious, “Be strong, do not fear! *
value.halfverse: Here is your God, coming with judgment to save you.”
and the ears of the deaf be unstopped.
value.verse: Then shall the eyes of the blind be opened, *
Then shall the lame leap like a deer, *
value.halfverse: and the tongue of the speechless sing for joy.
and streams in the desert;
value.verse: For waters shall break forth in the wilderness *

value.halfverse: and the thirsty ground, springs of water.
value.verse: The burning sand shall become a pool *
The ransomed of God shall return with singing, *
value.halfverse: with everlasting joy upon their heads.
and sorrow and sighing shall flee away.
value.verse: Joy and gladness shall be theirs, *
I will sing a new song to my God, *
value.halfverse: for you are great and glorious, wonderful in strength, invincible.

value.verse: Let the whole creation serve you, *
value.halfverse: for you spoke and all things came into being.
no one is able to resist your voice.
value.verse: You sent your breath and it formed them, *
Mountains and seas are stirred to their depths, *
value.halfverse: rocks melt like wax at your presence.
you continue to show mercy.
value.verse: But to those who fear you, *
No sacrifice, however fragrant, can please you, *
value.halfverse: but whoever fears the Lord shall stand in your sight for ever.

value.verse: Beloved, let us love one another, *
value.halfverse: for love is of God.

value.verse: Whoever does not love does not know God, *
value.halfverse: for God is Love.

value.verse: In this the love of God was revealed among us, *
value.halfverse:
that God sent his only Son into the world,
so that we might live through Jesus Christ.

value.verse: In this is love, not that we loved God but that God loved us *
value.halfverse: and sent his Son that sins might be forgiven.

value.verse: Beloved, since God loved us so much, *
value.halfverse: we ought also to love one another.

value.verse: For if we love one another, God abides in us, *
value.halfverse: and God’s love will be perfected in us.
to give to everyone according to their deeds.
value.verse:
“Behold, I am coming soon,” says the Lord,
“and bringing my reward with me, *

value.halfverse: the beginning and the end.”
value.verse: “I am the Alpha and the Omega, the first and the last, *

Blessed are those who do God’s commandments,
that they may have the right to the tree of life, *
value.halfverse: and may enter the city through the gates.
with this testimony for all the churches.
value.verse: “I, Jesus, have sent my angel to you, *

value.halfverse: I am the bright morning star.”
value.verse: “I am the root and the offspring of David, *
“Come!” say the Spirit and the Bride; *
value.halfverse: “Come!” let each hearer reply!
let those who desire take the water of life as a gift.
value.verse: Come forward, you who are thirsty, *
I called to you, O God, out of my distress, and you answered me; *
value.halfverse: out of the belly of Sheol I cried, and you heard my voice.

value.verse: You cast me into the deep, into the heart of the seas, *
value.halfverse:
and the flood surrounded me;
all your waves and billows passed over me.
how shall I ever look again upon your holy temple?”
value.verse: Then I said, “I am driven away from your sight; *

value.halfverse: weeds were wrapped around my head at the roots of the mountains.
value.verse: The waters closed in over me, the deep was round about me; *

value.halfverse: yet you brought up my life from the depths, O God.
value.verse: I went down to the land beneath the earth, *
As my life was ebbing away, I remembered you, O God, *
value.halfverse: and my prayer came to you, into your holy temple.
what I have vowed I will pay, for deliverance belongs to the Lord!
value.verse: With the voice of thanksgiving, I will sacrifice to you; *

We praise you, O God, 
we acclaim you as Lord; 
all creation worships you, 
the  Father  everlasting. 
To you all angels, all the powers of heaven, 
the cherubim and seraphim, sing in endless praise: 
	Holy, holy, holy Lord, God of power and might, 
	heaven and earth are full of your glory. 
The glorious company of apostles praise you. 
The noble fellowship of prophets praise you. 
The white-robed army of martyrs praise you. 
Throughout the world the holy Church acclaims you: 
	Father, of majesty unbounded, 
	your true and only Son, worthy of all worship, 
	and the Holy Spirit, advocate and guide. 
You, Christ, are the king of glory, 
the eternal Son of the Father. 
When you took our flesh to set us free 
you humbly chose the Virgin’s womb. 
You overcame the sting of death 
and opened the kingdom of heaven to all believers. 
You are seated at God’s right hand in glory. 
We believe that you will come to be our judge. 
	Come then, Lord, and help your people, 
	bought with the price of your own blood, 
	and bring us with your saints 
	to glory everlasting.

label: Canticle 18: A Song to the Lamb

value.halfverse: are yours by right, O God Most High,
value.verse: Splendor and honor and royal power *

value.halfverse: and by your will they were created and have their being;
value.verse: For you created everything that is, *

value.halfverse: for with your blood you have redeemed for God,
value.verse: And yours by right, O Lamb that was slain, *

value.halfverse: a royal priesthood to serve our God.
value.verse: From every family, language, people, and nation, *

value.halfverse: and to Christ the Lamb,
value.verse: And so, to the One who sits upon the throne, *

value.halfverse: for ever and for evermore.
value.verse: Be worship and praise, dominion and splendor, *
Though in the form of God, *
value.halfverse: Christ Jesus did not cling to equality with God,
and was born in human likeness.
value.verse: But emptied himself, taking the form of a servant, *

value.halfverse: and became obedient to death, even death on a cross.
value.verse: Being found in human form, he humbled himself *

value.halfverse: and given him the name above every name,
value.verse: Therefore, God has highly exalted him *

value.halfverse: in heaven and on earth and under the earth,
value.verse: That at the name of Jesus, every knee shall bow, *
And every tongue confess that Jesus Christ is Lord, *
value.halfverse: to the glory of God the Father.

value.verse: I saw no temple in the city, *
value.halfverse: for its temple is the God of surpassing strength and the Lamb.
for the glory of God shines on it, and its lamp is the Lamb.
value.verse: And the city has no need of sun or moon to light it, *

value.halfverse: and the rulers of the world lay their honor and glory there.
value.verse: By its light the nations shall walk, *

value.halfverse: into it they will bring the honor and glory of nations.
value.verse: Its gates shall never be shut by day, nor shall there be any night; *

value.halfverse: flowing from the throne of God and of the Lamb.
value.verse: I saw the clean river of the water of life, bright as crystal, *

value.halfverse: and the leaves of the tree were for the healing of nations.
value.verse: The tree of life spanned the river, giving fruit every month, *

value.halfverse: there they will see God’s face, whose Name shall be on their foreheads.
value.verse:
All curses cease where the throne of God and the Lamb stands,
and all servants give worship there; *

metadata.localname: A Song of the Heavenly City

value.verse: Jesus, as a mother you gather your people to you; *
value.halfverse: you are gentle with us as a mother with her children.
tenderly you draw us from hatred and judgment.
value.verse: Often you weep over our sins and our pride, *
You comfort us in sorrow and bind up our wounds, *
value.halfverse: in sickness you nurse us and with pure milk you feed us.
by your anguish and labor we come forth in joy.
value.verse: Jesus, by your dying, we are born to new life; *

value.halfverse: through your gentleness, we find comfort in fear.
value.verse: Despair turns to hope through your sweet goodness; *
Your warmth gives life to the dead, *
value.halfverse: your touch makes sinners righteous.
in your love and tenderness, remake us.
value.verse: Lord Jesus, in your mercy, heal us; *
In your compassion, bring grace and forgiveness, *
value.halfverse: for the beauty of heaven, may your love prepare us.
who has torn us and will heal us.
value.verse: Come, let us return to our God, *
God has struck us and will bind up our wounds, *
value.halfverse: after two days revive us,
that in God’s presence we may live.
value.verse: On the third day restore us, *
I went down to the land beneath the earth, *
value.halfverse:
yet you brought up my life from the depths, O God.
its dawning as sure as the sunrise.

value.verse: God’s justice will come to us like a shower, *
value.halfverse: like spring rains that water the earth.

value.verse: Is it nothing to you, all you who pass by? *
value.halfverse: Look and see if there is any sorrow like my sorrow,
inflicted by God’s fierce anger.
value.verse: Which was brought upon me, *
For these things I weep; my eyes flow with tears, *
value.halfverse: for a comforter is far from me, one to revive my courage.
wormwood and gall!
value.verse: Remember my affliction and my bitterness, *

value.halfverse: God’s mercies never end.
value.verse: The steadfast love of God never ceases, *
They are new every morning; *
value.halfverse: great is your faithfulness.
“therefore will I hope in God.”
value.verse: “God is my portion,” says my soul, *

value.halfverse: for the coming of God’s salvation.
value.verse: It is good that we should wait quietly *

value.halfverse:
for you have blessed us in Christ
with every spiritual blessing in the heavenly places.
value.verse: Blessed are you, the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, *
Before the world was made, you chose us to be yours in Christ, *
value.halfverse: that we should be holy and blameless before you.

value.verse: You destined us for adoption as your children through Jesus Christ, *
value.halfverse: according to the good pleasure of your will,
that you have freely given us in the Beloved.
value.verse: To the praise of your glorious grace, *
In you, we have redemption through the blood of Christ, *
value.halfverse: the forgiveness of our sins,
which you have lavished upon us.
value.verse: According to the riches of your grace *
You have made known to us, in all wisdom and insight, *
value.halfverse: the mystery of your will,

value.verse: According to your good pleasure which you set forth in Christ, *
value.halfverse: as a plan for the fullness of time,
things in heaven and things on earth.
value.verse: To gather together all things in Christ, *

value.halfverse:
and so made the foundation of his work,
most humbly and most pure, in the Virgin’s womb.
value.verse: God chose to be our mother in all things *
God, the perfect wisdom of all, *
value.halfverse: arrayed himself in this humble place.
to share a mother’s care.
value.verse: Christ came in our poor flesh *
Our mothers bear us for pain and for death; *
value.halfverse: our true mother, Jesus, bears us for joy and endless life.
until the full time of his passion.
value.verse: Christ carried us within him in love and travail, *

value.halfverse: still all this could not satisfy the power of his wonderful love.
value.verse: And when all was completed and he had carried us so for joy, *

value.halfverse:
for the love of Christ works in us;
Christ is the one whom we love.
value.verse: All that we owe is redeemed in truly loving God, *

value.halfverse: a holy people and a blameless race.
value.verse: Wisdom freed from a nation of oppressors *

value.halfverse: withstood dread rulers with wonders and signs.
value.verse: She entered the soul of a servant of the Lord, *

value.halfverse: and led them by a marvelous way;
value.verse: To the saints she gave the reward of their labors, *

value.halfverse: and a blaze of stars by night.
value.verse: She was their shelter by day *
She brought them across the Red Sea, *
value.halfverse: she led them through mighty waters;
and spewed them out from the depths of the abyss.
value.verse: But their enemies she swallowed in the waves *

value.halfverse: and praised with one voice your protecting hand;
value.verse: And then, Lord, the righteous sang hymns to your Name, *

value.halfverse: and gave speech to the tongues of a new-born people.
value.verse: For Wisdom opened the mouths of the mute, *

value.halfverse: my triumph song is lifted in you.
value.verse: My heart exults in you, O God; *
My mouth derides my enemies, *
value.halfverse: for I rejoice in your salvation.
nor any rock to be compared to you, our God.
value.verse: There is none holy like you, *

value.halfverse: Only God is knowing and weighs all actions.
value.verse: Do not heap up prideful words or speak in arrogance; *

value.halfverse: but the weak are clothed in strength.
value.verse: The bows of the mighty are broken, *
Those once full now labor for bread, *
value.halfverse: those who hungered now are well fed.
while the mother of many is forlorn.
value.verse: The childless woman has borne sevenfold, *

value.halfverse: gives wealth or takes it away, humbles and dignifies.
value.verse: God destroys and brings to life, casts down and raises up; *
God raises the poor from the dust; *
value.halfverse: and lifts the needy from the ash heap
and inherit a place of honor.
value.verse: To make them sit with the rulers *

value.halfverse: on which the whole earth is founded.
value.verse: For the pillars of the earth are God’s *

label: Canticle 12: A Song of Creation
citation: Song of the Three Young Men, 35-65

value.halfverse: sing praise and give honor for ever.
value.verse: Glorify the Lord, all you works of the Lord, *
In the high vault of heaven, glorify the Lord, *
value.halfverse: sing praise and give honor for ever.

value.verse: Glorify the Lord, you angels and all powers of the Lord, *
value.halfverse: O heavens and all waters above the heavens.

value.verse: Sun and moon and stars of the sky, glorify the Lord, *
value.halfverse: sing praise and give honor for ever.
all winds and fire and heat.
value.verse: Glorify the Lord, every shower of rain and fall of dew, *
Winter and Summer, glorify the Lord, *
value.halfverse: sing praise and give honor for ever.

value.verse: Glorify the Lord, O chill and cold, *
value.halfverse: drops of dew and flakes of snow
sing praise and give honor for ever.
value.verse: Frost and cold, ice and sleet, glorify the Lord, *
Glorify the Lord, O nights and days, *
value.halfverse: O shining light and enfolding dark.

value.verse: Storm clouds and thunderbolts, glorify the Lord, *
value.halfverse: sing praise and give honor for ever.

value.verse: Let the earth glorify the Lord, *
value.halfverse: sing praise and give honor for ever.
sing praise and give honor for ever.
value.verse: Glorify the Lord, O mountains and hills, and all that grows upon the earth, *

value.halfverse: O whales and all that move in the waters.
value.verse: Glorify the Lord, O springs of water, seas, and streams, *

value.halfverse: sing praise and give honor for ever.
value.verse: All birds of the air, glorify the Lord, *

value.halfverse: and all you flocks and herds.
value.verse: Glorify the Lord, O beasts of the wild, *
O men and women everywhere, glorify the Lord, *
value.halfverse: sing praise and give honor for ever.

value.label: II		The Earth and its Creatures

value.verse: Let the people of God glorify the Lord, *
value.halfverse: sing praise and give honor for ever.

value.verse: Glorify the Lord, O priests and servants of the Lord, *
value.halfverse: sing praise and give honor for ever.
sing praise and give honor for ever.
value.verse: Glorify the Lord, O spirits and souls of the righteous, *
You that are holy and humble of heart, glorify the Lord, *
value.halfverse: sing praise and give honor for ever.
sing praise and give honor for ever.
value.verse: Let us glorify the Lord:  Father, Son, and Holy Spirit; *
In the firmament of his power, glorify the Lord, *
value.halfverse: sing praise and give honor for ever.

value.verse: Rejoice with Jerusalem and be glad for her *
value.halfverse: all you who love her,
all you who mourn over her,
value.verse: Rejoice, rejoice with her, *

value.halfverse: from her comforting breast.
value.verse: That you may drink deeply with delight *

value.halfverse:
“I will extend peace to her like a river,
the wealth of nations like an overflowing stream.
value.verse: For thus says our God, *

value.halfverse: and you shall nestle in her lap.
value.verse: “You shall nurse and be carried on her arm, *
“As a mother comforts her child, so will I comfort you; *
value.halfverse: you shall be comforted in Jerusalem.
you shall flourish like the grass of the fields.”
value.verse: “You shall see, and your heart shall rejoice, *

metadata.localname: A Song of Jerusalem Our Mother
A Song of Our True Nature

value.halfverse: our trespasses and our humiliations.
value.verse: Christ revealed our frailty and our falling, *

value.halfverse: his blessed wisdom and love.
value.verse: Christ also revealed his blessed power, *
He protects us as tenderly and as sweetly when we are in greatest need; *
value.halfverse:
he raises us in spirit
and turns everything to glory and joy without ending.
God is the true father and mother of natures.
value.verse: God is the ground and the substance, the very essence of nature; *

value.halfverse: and we are all bound to God by grace.
value.verse: We are all bound to God by nature, *
And this grace is for all the world, *
value.halfverse: because it is our precious mother, Christ.

value.verse:
For this fair nature was prepared by Christ
for the honor and nobility of all, *
value.halfverse: and for the joy and bliss of salvation.

value.text: Let us give thanks to the Lord our God.

value.label: People
value.text: It is right to give our thanks and praise.

value:
It is truly right, and good and joyful, 
to give you thanks, all-holy God, 
source of life and fountain of mercy.

You have filled us and all creation with your blessing
and fed us with your constant love;
you have redeemed us in Jesus Christ
and knit us into one body.
Through your Spirit you replenish us
and call us to fullness of life.

Therefore, joining with Angels and Archangels 
and with the faithful of every generation, 
we lift our voices with all creation as we sing (say):

Holy, Holy, Holy Lord, God of power and might,
heaven and earth are full of your glory.
    Hosanna in the highest.
Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord.
    Hosanna in the highest.

Holy, Holy, Holy Lord, God of power and might,
heaven and earth are full of your glory.
    Hosanna in the highest.
Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord.
    Hosanna in the highest.

Blessed are you, gracious God, 
creator of the universe and giver of life. 
You formed us in your own image 
and called us to dwell in your infinite love.

You gave the world into our care 
that we might be your faithful stewards 
and show forth your bountiful grace.

But we failed to honor your image 
in one another and in ourselves; 
we would not see your goodness in the world around us; 
and so we violated your creation, 
abused one another, 
and rejected your love. 
Yet you never ceased to care for us, 
and prepared the way of salvation for all people.

Through Abraham and Sarah 
you called us into covenant with you. 
You delivered us from slavery, 
sustained us in the wilderness, 
and raised up prophets 
to renew your promise of salvation. 
Then, in the fullness of time, 
you sent your eternal Word, 
made mortal flesh in Jesus. 
Born into the human family, 
and dwelling among us, 
he revealed your glory. 
Giving himself freely to death on the cross, 
he triumphed over evil, 
opening the way of freedom and life.

At the following words concerning the bread, the Celebrant is to hold it, or to lay a hand upon it; and at the words concerning the cup, to hold or place a hand upon the cup and any other vessel containing wine to be consecrated.

On the night before he died for us, 
Our Savior Jesus Christ took bread, 
and when he had given thanks to you, 
he broke it, and gave it to his friends, and said: 
“Take, eat: 
This is my Body which is given for you. 
Do this for the remembrance of me.”

As supper was ending, Jesus took the cup of wine, 
and when he had given thanks, 
he gave it to them, and said: 
“Drink this, all of you: 
This is my Blood of the new Covenant, 
which is poured out for you and for all 
for the forgiveness of sins. 
Whenever you drink it, 
do this for the remembrance of me.”

value.text: Therefore we proclaim the mystery of faith:
value.response:
Christ has died.
Christ is risen.
Christ will come again.

value:
Remembering his death and resurrection, 
we now present to you from your creation 
this bread and this wine. 
By your Holy Spirit may they be for us 
the Body and Blood of our Savior Jesus Christ. 
Grant that we who share these gifts 
may be filled with the Holy Spirit 
and live as Christ’s Body in the world. 
Bring us into the everlasting heritage 
of your daughters and sons, 
that with [___________ and] all your saints, 
past, present, and yet to come, 
we may praise your Name for ever.

Through Christ and with Christ and in Christ, 
in the unity of the Holy Spirit, 
to you be honor, glory, and praise, 
for ever and ever.

value.text: The Lord be with you.
And also with you.

value.text: Lift up your hearts.
value.label: Celebrant

value.label: People
Celebrant
value.text: Lift up your hearts.
We lift them to the Lord.
value.label: People
Celebrant
value.text: Let us give thanks to the Lord our God.
It is right to give our thanks and praise.
value.label: People

value:
We praise you and we bless you, holy and gracious God,
source of life abundant.
From before time you made ready the creation.
Your Spirit moved over the deep
and brought all things into being:
sun, moon, and stars;
earth, winds, and waters;
and every living thing.
You made us in your image,
and taught us to walk in your ways.
But we rebelled against you, and wandered far away;
and yet, as a mother cares for her children,
you would not forget us.
Time and again you called us
to live in the fullness of your love.

And so this day we join with Saints and Angels
in the chorus of praise that rings through eternity,
lifting our voices to magnify you as we sing (say):

Holy, Holy, Holy Lord, God of power and might,
heaven and earth are full of your glory.
    Hosanna in the highest.
Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord.
    Hosanna in the highest.

Glory and honor and praise to you, holy and living God. 
To deliver us from the power of sin and death 
and to reveal the riches of your grace, 
you looked with favor upon Mary, your willing servant, 
that she might conceive and bear a son, 
Jesus the holy child of God. 
Living among us, Jesus loved us. 
He broke bread with outcasts and sinners, 
healed the sick, and proclaimed good news to the poor. 
He yearned to draw all the world to himself 
yet we were heedless of his call to walk in love. 
Then, the time came for him to complete upon the cross 
the sacrifice of his life, 
and to be glorified by you.

At the following words concerning the bread, the Celebrant is to hold it, or lay a hand upon it; and at the words concerning the cup, to hold or place a hand upon the cup and any other vessel containing the wine to be consecrated.

On the night before he died for us, 
Jesus was at table with his friends. 
He took bread, gave thanks to you, 
broke it, and gave it to them, and said: 
“Take, eat: 
This is my Body, which is given for you. 
Do this for the remembrance of me.” 
As supper was ending, Jesus took the cup of wine. 
Again, he gave thanks to you, 
gave it to them, and said: 
“Drink this, all of you: 
This is my Blood of the new Covenant, 
which is poured out for you and for all 
for the forgiveness of sins. 
Whenever you drink it, 
do this for the remembrance of me.”

Now gathered at your table, O God of all creation, 
and remembering Christ, crucified and risen, 
who was and is and is to come, 
we offer to you our gifts of bread and wine, 
and ourselves, a living sacrifice.

Pour out your Spirit upon these gifts 
that they may be the Body and Blood of Christ. 
Breathe your Spirit over the whole earth 
and make us your new creation, 
the Body of Christ given for the world you have made.

In the fullness of time bring us, 
with [___________ and] all your saints, 
from every tribe and language and people and nation, 
to feast at the banquet prepared 
from the foundation of the world.

Through Christ and with Christ and in Christ, 
in the unity of the Holy Spirit, 
to you be honor, glory, and praise, 
for ever and ever.

value.text: Let us give thanks to the Lord our God.
value.label: Celebrant

value.text: It is right to give our thanks and praise.
value.label: People

value:
All thanks and praise 
are yours at all times and in all places, 
our true and loving God; 
through Jesus Christ, your eternal Word, 
the Wisdom from on high by whom you created all things. 
You laid the foundations of the world 
and enclosed the sea when it burst out from the womb; 
You brought forth all creatures of the earth 
and gave breath to humankind.

Wondrous are you, Holy One of Blessing, 
all you create is a sign of hope for our journey; 
And so as the morning stars sing your praises 
we join the heavenly beings and all creation 
as we shout with joy:

Holy, Holy, Holy Lord, God of power and might,
heaven and earth are full of your glory.
    Hosanna in the highest.
Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord.
    Hosanna in the highest.

Holy, Holy, Holy Lord, God of power and might,
heaven and earth are full of your glory.
    Hosanna in the highest.
Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord.
    Hosanna in the highest.

Glory and honor are yours, Creator of all, 
your Word has never been silent; 
you called a people to yourself, as a light to the nations, 
you delivered them from bondage 
and led them to a land of promise. 
Of your grace, you gave Jesus 
to be human, to share our life, 
to proclaim the coming of your holy reign 
and give himself for us, a fragrant offering.

Through Jesus Christ our Redeemer, 
you have freed us from sin, 
brought us into your life, 
reconciled us to you, 
and restored us to the glory you intend for us.

We thank you that on the night before he died for us 
Jesus took bread, 
and when he had given thanks to you, he broke it, 
gave it to his friends and said: 
“Take, eat, this is my Body, broken for you. 
Do this for the remembrance of me.”

After supper Jesus took the cup of wine, 
said the blessing, gave it to his friends and said: 
“Drink this, all of you: 
this cup is the new Covenant in my Blood, 
poured out for you and for all 
for the forgiveness of sin. 
Do this for the remembrance of me.”

value.text:
And so, remembering all that was done for us: 
the cross, the tomb, the resurrection and ascension, 
longing for Christ’s coming in glory, 
and presenting to you these gifts 
your earth has formed and human hands have made, 
we acclaim you, O Christ:
value.response:
Dying, you destroyed our death.
Rising, you restored our life.
Christ Jesus, come in glory!

metadata.response: Blessed are you now and for ever. AMEN.

value:
Send your Holy Spirit upon us 
and upon these gifts of bread and wine 
that they may be to us 
the Body and Blood of your Christ. 
Grant that we, burning with your Spirit’s power, 
may be a people of hope, justice and love.

Giver of Life, draw us together in the Body of Christ, 
and in the fullness of time gather us 
with [blessed  _______,  and]  all  your  people 
into the joy of our true eternal home.

Through Christ and with Christ and in Christ, 
by the inspiration of your Holy Spirit, 
we worship you our God and Creator 
in voices of unending praise.

value: It is right, and a good and joyful thing, always and everywhere to give thanks to you, Father Almighty, Creator of heaven and earth.
It is right, and a good and joyful thing, always and everywhere to give thanks to you, Almighty God, Creator of heaven and earth.
Therefore we praise you, joining our voices with Angels and Archangels and with all the company of heaven, who for ever sing this hymn to proclaim the glory of your Name:

Holy, Holy, Holy Lord, God of power and might,
heaven and earth are full of your glory.
    Hosanna in the highest.
Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord.
    Hosanna in the highest.

Holy, Holy, Holy Lord, God of power and might,
heaven and earth are full of your glory.
    Hosanna in the highest.
Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord.
    Hosanna in the highest.

Holy and gracious Father: In your infinite love you made us for yourself, and, when we had fallen into sin and become subject to evil and death, you, in your mercy, sent Jesus Christ, your only and eternal Son, to share our human nature, to live and die as one of us, to reconcile us to you, the God and Father of all.
He stretched out his arms upon the cross, and offered himself, in obedience to your will, a perfect sacrifice for the whole world.

Holy and gracious God: In your infinite love you made us for yourself, and, when we had fallen into sin and become subject to evil and death, you, in your mercy, sent Jesus Christ, your only and eternal Son, to share our human nature, to live and die as one of us, to reconcile us to you, the God and maker of all.
Jesus stretched out his arms upon the cross, and offered himself, in obedience to your will, a perfect sacrifice for the whole world.

At the following words concerning the bread, the Celebrant is to hold it, or to lay a hand upon it; and at the words concerning the cup, to hold or place a hand upon the cup and any other vessel containing wine to be consecrated.

On the night he was handed over to suffering and death, our Lord Jesus Christ took bread; and when he had given thanks to you, he broke it, and gave it to his disciples, and said, “Take, eat: This is my Body, which is given for you. Do this for the remembrance of me.”

After supper he took the cup of wine; and when he had given thanks, he gave it to them, and said, “Drink this, all of you: This is my Blood of the new Covenant, which is shed for you and for many for the forgiveness of sins. Whenever you drink it, do this for the remembrance of me.”

On the night before he died for us, 
Our Savior Jesus Christ took bread, 
and when he had given thanks to you, 
he broke it, and gave it to his friends, and said: 
“Take, eat: 
This is my Body which is given for you. 
Do this for the remembrance of me.”

As supper was ending, Jesus took the cup of wine, 
and when he had given thanks, 
he gave it to them, and said: 
“Drink this, all of you: 
This is my Blood of the new Covenant, 
which is poured out for you and for all 
for the forgiveness of sins. 
Whenever you drink it, 
do this for the remembrance of me.”

On the night he was handed over to suffering and death, our Savior Jesus Christ took bread; and when he had given thanks to you, he broke it, and gave it to his disciples, and said, “Take, eat: This is my Body, which is given for you. Do this for the remembrance of me.”

After supper he took the cup of wine; and when he had given thanks, he gave it to them, and said, “Drink this, all of you: This is my Blood of the new Covenant, which is shed for you and for many for the forgiveness of sins. Whenever you drink it, do this for the remembrance of me.”

value.response:
Christ has died.
Christ is risen.
Christ will come again.
value.text: Therefore we proclaim the mystery of faith:

value: We celebrate the memorial of our redemption, O Father, in this sacrifice of praise and thanksgiving. Recalling his death, resurrection, and ascension, we offer you these gifts.

Sanctify them by your Holy Spirit to be for your people the Body and Blood of your Son, the holy food and drink of new and unending life in him. Sanctify us also that we may faithfully receive this holy Sacrament, and serve you in unity, constancy, and peace; and at the last day bring us with all your saints into the joy of your eternal kingdom.
All this we ask through your Son Jesus Christ: By him, and with him, and in him, in the unity of the Holy Spirit all honor and glory is yours, Almighty Father, now and for ever.
We celebrate the memorial of our redemption, Almighty God, in this sacrifice of praise and thanksgiving. Recalling his death, resurrection, and ascension, we offer you these gifts.

Sanctify them by your Holy Spirit to be for your people the Body and Blood of your Son, the holy food and drink of new and unending life in Christ. Sanctify us also that we may faithfully receive this holy Sacrament, and serve you in unity, constancy, and peace; and at the last day bring us with all your saints into the joy of your eternal kingdom.
All this we ask through Jesus Christ our Savior: By Christ, and with Christ, and in Christ, in the unity of the Holy Spirit all honor and glory is yours, Almighty God, now and for ever.

value: It is right, and a good and joyful thing, always and everywhere to give thanks to you, Father Almighty, Creator of heaven and earth.
It is right, and a good and joyful thing, always and everywhere to give thanks to you, Almighty God, Creator of heaven and earth.
Therefore we praise you, joining our voices with Angels and Archangels and with all the company of heaven, who for ever sing this hymn to proclaim the glory of your Name:

Holy, Holy, Holy Lord, God of power and might,
heaven and earth are full of your glory.
    Hosanna in the highest.
Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord.
    Hosanna in the highest.

Holy, Holy, Holy Lord, God of power and might,
heaven and earth are full of your glory.
    Hosanna in the highest.
Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord.
    Hosanna in the highest.

We give thanks to you, O God, for the goodness and love which you have made known to us in creation; in the calling of Israel to be your people; in your Word spoken through the prophets; and above all in the Word made flesh, Jesus, your Son. For in these last days you sent him to be incarnate from the Virgin Mary, to be the Savior and Redeemer of the world. In him, you have delivered us from evil, and made us worthy to stand before you. In him, you have brought us out of error into truth, out of sin into righteousness, out of death into life.

We give thanks to you, O God, for the goodness and love which you have made known to us in creation; in the calling of Israel to be your people; in your Word spoken through the prophets; and above all in Jesus Christ, the Word made flesh. For in these last days you sent Jesus to be incarnate from the Virgin Mary, to be the Savior and Redeemer of the world. In Christ, you have delivered us from evil, and made us worthy to stand before you. In Christ, you have brought us out of error into truth, out of sin into righteousness, out of death into life.

At the following words concerning the bread, the Celebrant is to hold it, or to lay a hand upon it; and at the words concerning the cup, to hold or place a hand upon the cup and any other vessel containing wine to be consecrated.

On the night before he died for us, our Lord Jesus Christ took bread; and when he had given thanks to you, he broke it, and gave it to his disciples, and said, “Take, eat: This is my Body, which is given for you. Do this for the remembrance of me.”

After supper he took the cup of wine; and when he had given thanks, he gave it to them, and said, “Drink this, all of you: This is my Blood of the new Covenant, which is shed for you and for many for the forgiveness of sins. Whenever you drink it, do this for the remembrance of me.”

On the night before he died for us, our Savior Jesus Christ took bread; and when he had given thanks to you, he broke it, and gave it to his disciples, and said, “Take, eat: This is my Body, which is given for you. Do this for the remembrance of me.”

After supper Jesus took the cup of wine; and when he had given thanks, he gave it to them, and said, “Drink this, all of you: This is my Blood of the new Covenant, which is shed for you and for many for the forgiveness of sins. Whenever you drink it, do this for the remembrance of me.”

value.text: Therefore, according to his command, O Father,
Therefore, according to his command, O Father,

value: And we offer our sacrifice of praise and thanksgiving to you, O Lord of all; presenting to you, from your creation, this bread and this wine.

We pray you, gracious God, to send your Holy Spirit upon these gifts that they may be the Sacrament of the Body of Christ and his Blood of the new Covenant. Unite us to your Son in his sacrifice, that we may be acceptable through him, being sanctified by the Holy Spirit. In the fullness of time, put all things in subjection under your Christ, and bring us to that heavenly country where, with [________ and] all your saints, we may enter the everlasting heritage of your sons and daughters; through Jesus Christ our Lord, the firstborn of all creation, the head of the Church, and the author of our salvation.
By him, and with him, and in him, in the unity of the Holy Spirit all honor and glory is yours, Almighty Father, now and for ever.
And we offer our sacrifice of praise and thanksgiving to you, O Savior of all; presenting to you, from your creation, this bread and this wine.

We pray you, gracious God, to send your Holy Spirit upon these gifts that they may be the Sacrament of the Body of Christ and his Blood of the new Covenant. Unite us in the sacrifice of Jesus Christ, through whom we are acceptable to you, being sanctified by the Holy Spirit. In the fullness of time, put all things in subjection under your Christ, and bring us to that heavenly country where, with [________ and] all your saints, we may enter the everlasting heritage of your children; through Jesus Christ our Lord, the firstborn of all creation, the head of the Church, and the author of our salvation.
By Christ, and with Christ, and in Christ, in the unity of the Holy Spirit all honor and glory is yours, Almighty God, now and for ever.

value.label: People

value: It is truly right to glorify you, Father, and to give you thanks; for you alone are God, living and true, dwelling in light inaccessible from before time and for ever.
Fountain of life and source of all goodness, you made all things and fill them with your blessing; you created them to rejoice in the splendor of your radiance.

Countless throngs of angels stand before you to serve you night and day; and, beholding the glory of your presence, they offer you unceasing praise. Joining with them, and giving voice to every creature under heaven, we acclaim you, and glorify your Name, as we sing (say),
It is truly right to glorify you, Holy One, and to give you thanks; for you alone are God, living and true, dwelling in light inaccessible from before time and for ever.
Fountain of life and source of all goodness, you made all things and fill them with your blessing; you created them to rejoice in the splendor of your radiance.

Countless throngs of angels stand before you to serve you night and day; and, beholding the glory of your presence, they offer you unceasing praise. Joining with them, and giving voice to every creature under heaven, we acclaim you, and glorify your Name, as we sing (say),

Holy, Holy, Holy Lord, God of power and might,
heaven and earth are full of your glory.
    Hosanna in the highest.
Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord.
    Hosanna in the highest.

Holy, Holy, Holy Lord, God of power and might,
heaven and earth are full of your glory.
    Hosanna in the highest.
Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord.
    Hosanna in the highest.

We acclaim you, holy Lord, glorious in power. Your mighty works reveal your wisdom and love. You formed us in your own image, giving the whole world into our care, so that, in obedience to you, our Creator, we might rule and serve all your creatures. When our disobedience took us far from you, you did not abandon us to the power of death. In your mercy you came to our help, so that in seeking you we might find you. Again and again you called us into covenant with you, and through the prophets you taught us to hope for salvation.

Father, you loved the world so much that in the fullness of time you sent your only Son to be our Savior. Incarnate by the Holy Spirit, born of the Virgin Mary, he lived as one of us, yet without sin. To the poor he proclaimed the good news of salvation; to prisoners, freedom; to the sorrowful, joy. To fulfill your purpose he gave himself up to death; and, rising from the grave, destroyed death, and made the whole creation new.

And, that we might live no longer for ourselves, but for him who died and rose for us, he sent the Holy Spirit, his own first gift for those who believe, to complete his work in the world, and to bring to fulfillment the sanctification of all.

We acclaim you, holy God, glorious in power. Your mighty works reveal your wisdom and love. You formed us in your own image, giving the whole world into our care, so that, in obedience to you, our Creator, we might rule and serve all your creatures. When our disobedience took us far from you, you did not abandon us to the power of death. In your mercy you came to our help, so that in seeking you we might find you. Again and again you called us into covenant with you, and through the prophets you taught us to hope for salvation.

Holy God, you loved the world so much that in the fullness of time you sent your only Son to be our Savior. Incarnate by the Holy Spirit, born of the Virgin Mary, Jesus lived as one of us, yet without sin. To the poor he proclaimed the good news of salvation; to prisoners, freedom; to the sorrowful, joy. To fulfill your purpose Jesus gave himself up to death; and, rising from the grave, destroyed death, and made the whole creation new.

And, that we might live no longer for ourselves, but for Christ who died and rose for us, you sent the Holy Spirit, your own first gift for those who believe, to complete your work in the world, and to bring to fulfillment the sanctification of all.

At the following words concerning the bread, the Celebrant is to hold it, or to lay a hand upon it; and at the words concerning the cup, to hold or place a hand upon the cup and any other vessel containing wine to be consecrated.

When the hour had come for him to be glorified by you, his
heavenly Father, having loved his own who were in the
world, he loved them to the end; at supper with them he took
bread, and when he had given thanks to you, he broke it, and
gave it to his disciples, and said, “Take, eat: This is my Body,
which is given for you. Do this for the remembrance of me.”

After supper he took the cup of wine; and when he had given
thanks, he gave it to them, and said, “Drink this, all of you:
This is my Blood of the new Covenant, which is shed for you
and for many for the forgiveness of sins. Whenever you drink
it, do this for the remembrance of me.”

When the hour had come for Jesus to be glorified by you, his
heavenly Father, having loved his own who were in the
world, he loved them to the end; at supper with them Jesus took
bread, and when he had given thanks to you, he broke it, and
gave it to his disciples, and said, “Take, eat: This is my Body,
which is given for you. Do this for the remembrance of me.”

After supper Jesus took the cup of wine; and when he had given
thanks, he gave it to them, and said, “Drink this, all of you:
This is my Blood of the new Covenant, which is shed for you
and for many for the forgiveness of sins. Whenever you drink
it, do this for the remembrance of me.”

value.response:
We praise you, we bless you,
we give thanks to you,
and we pray to you, Lord our God.
value.text: Father, we now celebrate this memorial of our redemption. Recalling Christ's death and his descent among the dead, proclaiming his resurrection and ascension to your right hand, awaiting his coming in glory; and offering to you, from the gifts you have given us, this bread and this cup, we praise you and we bless you.

value.response:
We praise you, we bless you,
we give thanks to you,
and we pray to you, Lord our God.
value.text: Almighty God, we now celebrate this memorial of our redemption. Recalling Christ's death and his descent among the dead, proclaiming Christ’s resurrection and ascension to your right hand, awaiting Christ’s coming in glory; and offering to you, from the gifts you have given us, this bread and this cup, we praise you and we bless you.

value: God our Creator, we pray that in your goodness and mercy your Holy Spirit may descend upon us, and upon these gifts, sanctifying them and showing them to be holy gifts for your holy people, the bread of life and the cup of salvation, the Body and Blood of our Savior Jesus Christ.
Grant that all who share this bread and cup may become one body and one spirit, a living sacrifice in Christ, to the praise of your Name.
Remember, Lord, your one holy catholic and apostolic Church, redeemed by the blood of your Christ. Reveal its unity, guard its faith, and preserve it in peace.
[Remember (NN. and) all who minister in your Church.]
[Remember all your people, and those who seek your truth.]
[Remember all who have died in the peace of Christ, and those whose faith is known to you alone; bring them into the place of eternal joy and light.]

And grant that we may find our inheritance with [the Blessed Virgin Mary, with patriarchs, prophets, apostles, and martyrs, (with ____________) and] all the saints who have found favor with you in ages past. We praise you in union with them and give you glory through your Son Jesus Christ our Lord.

Lord, we pray that in your goodness and mercy your Holy Spirit may descend upon us, and upon these gifts, sanctifying them and showing them to be holy gifts for your holy people, the bread of life and the cup of salvation, the Body and Blood of your Son Jesus Christ.
Grant that all who share this bread and cup may become one body and one spirit, a living sacrifice in Christ, to the praise of your Name.
Remember, Lord, your one holy catholic and apostolic Church, redeemed by the blood of your Christ. Reveal its unity, guard its faith, and preserve it in peace.
[Remember (NN. and) all who minister in your Church.]
[Remember all your people, and those who seek your truth.]
[Remember all who have died in the peace of Christ, and those whose faith is known to you alone; bring them into the place of eternal joy and light.]

And grant that we may find our inheritance with [the Blessed Virgin Mary, with patriarchs, prophets, apostles, and martyrs, (with ____________) and] all the saints who have found favor with you in ages past. We praise you in union with them and give you glory through your Son Jesus Christ our Lord.
Through Christ, and with Christ, and in Christ, all honor and glory are yours, Almighty God and Father, in the unity of the Holy Spirit, for ever and ever.
